an4.58:4.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,
an4.58:4.2: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an4.58:5.1: “Householder, when a noble disciple gives food, they give the recipients four things.
an4.58:5.3: Long life, beauty, happiness, and strength.
an4.58:5.4: Giving long life, they have long life as a god or human. …
an4.58:5.6: When a noble disciple gives food, they give the recipients these four things.”
an4.58:6.1: “Carefully giving food at the right time,
an4.58:6.2: to those who are restrained, eating only what others give,
an4.58:6.3: you provide them with four things:
an4.58:6.4: long life, beauty, happiness, and strength.
